001package com.technototes.library.hardware.sensor;
002
003import com.qualcomm.hardware.bosch.BNO055IMU;
004import com.qualcomm.hardware.bosch.BNO055IMUImpl;
005import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.AngleUnit;
006import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.AngularVelocity;
007import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.AxesOrder;
008import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.navigation.Orientation;
009
010/**
011 * Class for the BNO055 (Inertial Movement Units) that implements the IGyro interface
012 */
013@SuppressWarnings("unused")
014public class IMU extends Sensor<BNO055IMUImpl> implements IGyro {
015
016    private double angleOffset = 0;
017
018    /**
019     * The direction of the axes signs when remapping the axes
020     */
021    public enum AxesSigns {
022        /**
023         * Positive, Positive, Positive
024         */
025        PPP(0b000),
026        /**
027         * Positive, Positive, Negative
028         */
029        PPN(0b001),
030        /**
031         * Positive, Negative, Positive
032         */
033        PNP(0b010),
034        /**
035         * Positive, Negative, Negative
036         */
037        PNN(0b011),
038        /**
039         * Negative, Positive, Positive
040         */
041        NPP(0b100),
042        /**
043         * Negative, Positive, Negative
044         */
045        NPN(0b101),
046        /**
047         * Negative, Negative, Positive
048         */
049        NNP(0b110),
050        /**
051         * Negative, Negative, Negative
052         */
053        NNN(0b111);
054
055        /**
056         * The value of the enumeration
057         */
058        public final int bVal;
059
060        /**
061         * Sets the enum to the integer
062         *
063         * @param bVal The value (should be 0-7)
064         */
065        AxesSigns(int bVal) {
066            this.bVal = bVal;
067        }
068    }
069
070    private BNO055IMU.Parameters parameters;
071
072    /**
073     * Make an imu
074     *
075     * @param device The imu device
076     */
077    public IMU(BNO055IMUImpl device) {
078        super(device);
079        parameters = new BNO055IMU.Parameters();
080        degrees();
081        initialize();
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Make an imu
086     *
087     * @param deviceName The device name in hardware map
088     */
089    public IMU(String deviceName) {
090        super(deviceName);
091        parameters = new BNO055IMU.Parameters();
092        degrees();
093        initialize();
094    }
095
096    /**
097     * Set angle format to degrees
098     *
099     * @return this
100     */
101    public IMU degrees() {
102        parameters.angleUnit = BNO055IMU.AngleUnit.DEGREES;
103        return this;
104    }
105
106    /**
107     * Set angle format to radians
108     *
109     * @return this (for chaining)
110     */
111    public IMU radians() {
112        parameters.angleUnit = BNO055IMU.AngleUnit.RADIANS;
113        return this;
114    }
115
116    /**
117     * Initialize the IMU
118     *
119     * @return the IMU (for chaining)
120     */
121    public IMU initialize() {
122        getDevice().initialize(parameters);
123        return this;
124    }
125
126    /**
127     * Get gyro heading
128     *
129     * @return The gyro heading
130     */
131    @Override
132    public double gyroHeading() {
133        return getAngularOrientation().firstAngle;
134    }
135
136    /**
137     * Get the gyro heading in the provided units
138     *
139     * @param unit the unit desired
140     * @return The heading in 'unit' units
141     */
142    public double gyroHeading(AngleUnit unit) {
143        return unit.fromUnit(device.getAngularOrientation().angleUnit, gyroHeading() - angleOffset);
144    }
145
146    /**
147     * Gets the gyro heading in degrees
148     *
149     * @return the heading
150     */
151    @Override
152    public double gyroHeadingInDegrees() {
153        return gyroHeading(AngleUnit.DEGREES);
154    }
155
156    /**
157     * Gets the gyro heading in radians
158     *
159     * @return the heading
160     */
161    @Override
162    public double gyroHeadingInRadians() {
163        return gyroHeading(AngleUnit.RADIANS);
164    }
165
166    /**
167     * Sets the current heading to be 'new heading'
168     *
169     * @param newHeading The new heading (in default units)
170     */
171    @Override
172    public void setHeading(double newHeading) {
173        angleOffset = gyroHeading() - newHeading;
174    }
175
176    /**
177     * Remaps the axes for the IMU in the order and sign provided
178     *
179     * @param order The axis order desired
180     * @param signs The signs desired
181     * @return this (for chaining)
182     */
183    public IMU remapAxes(AxesOrder order, AxesSigns signs) {
184        try {
185            // the indices correspond with the 2-bit encodings specified in the datasheet
186            int[] indices = order.indices();
187            int axisMapConfig = 0;
188            axisMapConfig |= (indices[0] << 4);
189            axisMapConfig |= (indices[1] << 2);
190            axisMapConfig |= (indices[2]);
191
192            // the BNO055 driver flips the first orientation vector so we also flip here
193            int axisMapSign = signs.bVal ^ (0b100 >> indices[0]);
194
195            // Enter CONFIG mode
196            getDevice()
197                .write8(BNO055IMU.Register.OPR_MODE, BNO055IMU.SensorMode.CONFIG.bVal & 0x0F);
198
199            Thread.sleep(100);
200
201            // Write the AXIS_MAP_CONFIG register
202            getDevice().write8(BNO055IMU.Register.AXIS_MAP_CONFIG, axisMapConfig & 0x3F);
203
204            // Write the AXIS_MAP_SIGN register
205            getDevice().write8(BNO055IMU.Register.AXIS_MAP_SIGN, axisMapSign & 0x07);
206
207            // Switch back to the previous mode
208            getDevice()
209                .write8(BNO055IMU.Register.OPR_MODE, getDevice().getParameters().mode.bVal & 0x0F);
210
211            Thread.sleep(100);
212        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
213            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
214        }
215        parameters = getDevice().getParameters();
216        return this;
217    }
218
219    /**
220     * Gets the angular velocity (in default units)
221     *
222     * @return The Angular Velocity
223     */
224    public AngularVelocity getAngularVelocity() {
225        return device.getAngularVelocity();
226    }
227
228    /**
229     * Gets the Angular orientation of the IMU
230     *
231     * @return the Orientation of the IMU
232     */
233    public Orientation getAngularOrientation() {
234        return device.getAngularOrientation();
235    }
236}
